intro: Lophiolepis albida, commonly known as the white-flowered lichen grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many species adapted to Mediterranean climates. The plant is characterized by its dense, tufted growth and small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies.
